title: Type in branding
content:
I've a client who needs some resource material to which he can refer prior to presenting a new typeface to a client of his.   
'Branding with Type'-S.Rogener, is too basic, the guy knows a sans from a serif...but he needs some confidence building/deeper understanding.   
are there any books or websites you'd recommend?
author: miles

comments.content:
Miles, this seems like a good place to start:   
   
 [http://www.typobrand.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109112630/http:/www.typobrand.com/)

A few weeks ago I launched this 'corporate fonts' portal, which might be helpful. Hesitated to recommend it earlier as the resources I include may lead your customer to other sources ;-)   
   
 [http://www.microsoft.com/typography/links/FontPortal.aspx?PID=4](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109112630/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/links/FontPortal.aspx?PID=4)

Tiffany:   
   
I will back you up on that suggestion.   
That is a solid book, with some great   
"real world" advice.   
   
Hildebrant.

Some good articles   
 [http://www.identityworks.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109112630/http:/www.identityworks.com/)   
   
Also checkout the links section, has links to many firms that do identity / brand work.
